column6: Text
How do you deal with attachment to relationships? My dad has cancer and may possibly not be here next year.
How do we deal with the complications that go into the loss of loved ones?
I heard the word _samatonsin_ all my life, but never knew it means 'to hold it rightly.' Is there a way to hold it wrongly?
Ajahn Passanno accidentally drinks fruit juice mixed with vodka at a family gathering.
Is there a way to skillfully form and investigate opinions about the world in terms of Right View?
What happens when we see that another person's view causes suffering and pain?
A black man asks a KKK member, "Why do you hate people you have never met?"
Does physical pain fit under sensuality as the opposite, pushing away?
Snp 4.6 says something about not clinging to passion and dispassion. Usually I hear that cultivating dispassion is a good thing.
about the meaning of quarrels in meditation and in daily life.
Can you distinguish between clinging and craving?
How do we break the chain of dependent origination?
As you're falling out of a tree, you're not counting the branches as you go down. All you know is that when you hit the bottom, it's going to hurt.|Ajahn Chah
Snp 4.5 and Snp 4.6 refer to what is seen, heard and thought. Is there more to this than developing awareness of what you're thinking, hearing, and seeing?
How do we make sense of the whirlpool of assumptions?
Welcome to the human existence.
In AN 9.41, does the Buddha enumerate the drawbacks of sensuality?

"[Drawbacks](https://www.accesstoinsight.org/ptf/dhamma/adinava/index.html)," part of [_A Path to Freedom: A Self-guided Tour of the Buddha's Teachings_](https://www.accesstoinsight.org/ptf/index.html) on accesstoinsight.org.
MN 13: Mahādukkhakkhandha Sutta
Can you speak about the relationship between renunciation and moderation?
The common root of renunciation and compassion is the relationship to suffering.
"[The Balanced Way](https://www.accesstoinsight.org/lib/authors/bodhi/bps-essay_08.html)" by Bhikkhu Bodhi on accesstoinsight.org.
The mind can get caught on relinquishment itself.
Renunciation sometimes requires decisively turning against established patterns.
Is it possible that [Parami]() will be reprinted?
How does renuciation reinforce compassion?
Snp 1.8: The Metta Sutta.
During the construction of a new hall, an engineer asks when it will be finished.|Tonight. Comes the evening, it's finished. Tomorrow morning, I might do it again.|Ajahn Liem
